definition: Li ethnic group of Hainan Province/surname Li/abbr. for Lebanon 黎巴嫩[Li2 ba1 nen4]

sentences.english: Before being engaged in movie business, his favorite was drama.
sentences.chinese: 在從事電影事業之前，黎民偉最喜愛的還是戲劇。

sentences.english: The rulers should consider the interests of the multitude.
sentences.chinese: 統治者要爲黎民的利益着想。

sentences.english: There are two reasons for the improvement in peoplewouls living conditions.
sentences.chinese: 黎民生活情況的改善原因有兩點。

sentences.english: Why do criminals have more human rights than the common law abiding citizen?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼罪犯們比一般遵法黎民得到更多的人權？

sentences.english: I wish to change some British sterling into Renminbisexual.
sentences.chinese: 我想把一些英鎊換成黎民幣。

sentences.english: Protect people a particulard nines with fair laws a particulard merely courts.
sentences.chinese: 用公正的法律與法庭來保證黎民與國度。

sentences.english: Write like the learned ; speak like the minvestigbye.
sentences.chinese: 寫作要像常識分子，說話要像黎民專家。

sentences.english: Men are cruel- but Man is kind.
sentences.chinese: 獨夫們是兇暴的，但黎民是善良的。

sentences.english: In order to save the people, he tirelessly studied Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 爲了拯救黎民百姓，他孜孜不倦地鑽研祖國醫學。

sentences.english: People in many countries are enduring public harizonaards.
sentences.chinese: 現在許多國度的黎民飽受公害之苦。

definition: state/country/the Gods of earth and grain
lit. to rescue the people from hanging upside down (idiom, from Mencius); to save the people from dire straits
people are in a terrible situation (idiom)
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
lit. the pain of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation/dire straits
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
